name: Blue Cheese Chicken
author: Elizabeth Saben
summary: My husband created this dish on Valentine's day our second year of marriage. We didn't have a lot of money and he wanted to create something special for me. It has been a favorite ever since. Easy to make and delicious!
ingredients: 1 ½ (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
2  skinless, boneless chicken breasts, halved and pounded into 1/2-inch thickness
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Stir cream cheese and blue cheese together in a bowl
Beat egg in a separate bowl
Pour bread crumbs into a third shallow bowl
Spread cheese mixture over each chicken piece
Roll each piece of chicken around filling; dip into egg and press into bread crumbs until coated
Arrange chicken rolls on a baking sheet or baking pan
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 20 to 30 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Cheese mixture will start to run out when done
